titleInfo.title: FUNDING FOR THE NATIONAL HUMAN TRAFFICKING HOTLINE

extension.searchTitle: FUNDING FOR THE NATIONAL HUMAN TRAFFICKING HOTLINE; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 170

congVote.result: So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and the bill was passed.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory2: Ensuring funding for the National Human Trafficking Hotline
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measures:<P/>H.R. 5422, to ensure funding for the National Human Trafficking Hotline, by a \2/3\ yea-and-nay vote of 399 yeas with none voting ``nay'', Roll No. 588;

titleInfo.title: EXPANSION OF ELIGIBILITY FOR HEADSTONES, MARKERS, AND MEDALLIONS FOR MEDAL OF HONOR RECIPIENTS

extension.searchTitle: EXPANSION OF ELIGIBILITY FOR HEADSTONES, MARKERS, AND MEDALLIONS FOR MEDAL OF HONOR RECIPIENTS; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 170

congVote.result: So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and the bill, as amended, was passed.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory2: Amending title 38, United States Code, to expand the eligibility for headstones, markers, and medallions furnished by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs for deceased individuals who were awarded the Medal of Honor and are buried in private cemeteries
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measures:<P/>H.R. 4757, amended, to amend title 38, United States Code, to expand the eligibility for headstones, markers, and medallions furnished by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs for deceased individuals who were awarded the Medal of Honor and are buried in private cemeteries, by a \2/3\ yea-and-nay vote of 401 yeas with none voting ``nay'', Roll No. 589;

extension.searchTitle: EXPANDING CAPACITY FOR HEALTH OUTCOMES ACT; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 170

congVote.result: The bill (S. 2873), as amended, was passed.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory2: Expanding Capacity for Health Outcomes Act
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: <P/>Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions was discharged from further consideration of S. 2873, to require studies and reports examining the use of, and opportunities to use, technology-enabled collaborative learning and capacity building models to improve programs of the Department of Health and Human Services, and the bill was then passed by a unanimous vote of 97 yeas (Vote No. 154), after taking action on the following amendment proposed thereto:
